title: Yet the Worst Olympic Chart
excerpt: The Olympics barely began but we already have the worst chart winner.

title: Calculating Memory Requirements
excerpt: A post about size and memory requirements that a computer must have to deal with a data frame.

title: What is reproducible research?
excerpt: This entry states a minimalist view of reproducible research: The capacity of repeating an experiment in any place with any person.

title: R packaging industry close-up: How fast are we growing?
excerpt: This entry brings in a quick analysis of the rate R packages have been published in the official repository (CRAN).

title: Everything Ends on Wednesday
excerpt: This post approaches HIV incidence rate among Brazilians and simulates several levels of HIV infection.

title: The Star Wars Grossing War
excerpt: This post shows how to scrap data from 'boxofficemojo.com', then to clean and visualize the data.

title: Gender Effect in Conference Talks
excerpt: The entry discuss a study that finds strong gender effects in conference talks

title: Venezuelan Parliamentary Election: What do the Polls Say?
excerpt: This entry explores the coming legislative election in Venezuela: Government is about to lose the majority.

title: Venezuela's 2015 Parliamentary Elections
excerpt: This post shows the tremendous variability from pollster to pollster about the voting intention among Venezuelans.

title: Retrieving Data from Google Books with `ngramr`
excerpt: The post explores the Google Ngram Viewer service requested from.

title: Competing views on Argentina's Frontrunner
excerpt: This post analyze the very few polls published so far on the Argentina's runoff election. Overall, polls seem to be telling two distinct histories.

title: House Effects in Argentinian polling
excerpt: This post presents the estimated house effects for the main presidential candidates in Argentina, considering more than 115 polls since 2014.

title: Paranormal Distribution
excerpt: This is funny.

title: A Talk About Campaign Finance in Brazil
excerpt: This post provides some unsolicited comments on the campaign finance issue.

title: Understanding Margin of Error for Small Populations
excerpt: This post discusses margin of error, gives some theoretical reasons and apply them to a real poll.

title: The Butterfly Curve
excerpt: This post shows the implementation of the butterfly curve equation in R, and its output plot produced with ggplot2.

title: Isn't sad that all that matters in an election is the candidate's height?
excerpt: This post discusses the importance of candidates' stature in US presidential elections.

title: The Greek thing
excerpt: This post uses Bayesian methods to analyze polling data of Greek Referendum.

title: R has a new consortium, should we celebrate?
excerpt: This post presents some ideas about the new R Consortium.

title: Frente Amplio Winnability
excerpt: This entry briefly analyzes the population of polls for the coming elections in Uruguay.

title: Runoff in Uruguay: FA is expected to win a third mandate
excerpt: This entry briefly analyzes the population of polls for the coming election in Uruguay: Voters will decide between FA and PN in a short runoff election.

title: A Bit More Fragmented
excerpt: This entry discusses the legislative elections in Brazil, which turned out to produce one of the most fragmented parliament in the world.

title: Yep. He made it; country voted No
excerpt: This post talks big about my last predictions for the Referendum in Scotland.

title: Bayes says `don't worry` about Scotland's Referendum
excerpt: This post uses Bayesian methods to show the anti-independence vote has an overwhelming advantage over the pro-independence side.

title: Discontinuity Bayesian Forecasting
excerpt: The post presents some ideas of a more robust Bayesian linear filtering models to forecast Brazilian subnational elections.

title: Parallel computing in R
excerpt: This post shows parallel computing is incredibly useful, but not every thing worths being distributed across as many cores as possible.

title: Do you believe in World Cup superstition?
excerpt: If you believe in supernatural causality, you will love what the numbers say about the World Cup in Brazil.

title: Got Bootstrap?
excerpt: This post discuss some of the techniques of bootstrapping in R, presented in the new book by Michael Chernick and Robert LaBudde.

title: Parallel Processing: When does it worth?
excerpt: This post shows parallel computing is incredibly useful, but not every thing worths being distributed across as many cores as possible.

title: Showing Explained Variance in Multilevel Models
excerpt: The post shows a way of displaying explained variance of multilevel models using line chart.

title: Theme Setup
excerpt: Instructions on how to install and customize the Jekyll theme So Simple.
